97f98e5df342.description: Perspectives of a 2x entrepreneur turned VC at @UpfrontVC, the largest and most active early-stage fund in Southern California. Snapchat: msuster
97f98e5df342.name: Both Sides of the Table
97f98e5df342.shortDescription: Perspectives of a 2x entrepreneur turned VC at @UpfrontVC…

paragraphs.text: Jason asked Mark is he thought it was possible to build non-Silicon Valley successful startups.
paragraphs.name: 2a93

paragraphs.text: We all fall into the same trap, we roll our eyes at what he says and then think we’re going to use logic to convince his supporters to change their minds — it doesn’t work.
paragraphs.name: 58d5

paragraphs.text: Mark made a fortune by being early in Local Area Networking, streaming and then High Definition video so perhaps it’s worth listening. He said that he believes AI will have a bigger impact than any technology in the last 30 years.

paragraphs.name: 69f3
paragraphs.text: Mark also said that what happens in the next 5–10 years is just going to blow everybody away, especially in the field of automation. He thinks even programming is vulnerable to being automated and reducing the number of available programming jobs.

There were many famous speakers and attendees at the Upfront Summit but I was given a very strict assignment by my two boys (11 & 13) — the only thing they cared about was that I got a photo with Mark Cuban. They are huge fans of Shark Tank. Often my sons are in the car when I’m talking with entrepreneurs or my partners about deals. After years of watching Shark Tank it’s heartening to hear them make comments like, “I don’t know why he gave up so much equity? Why didn’t he just do a licensing deal?” Ha. Gotta love great role models. So here ya go, boys.
paragraphs.name: cb35

a624cd0e62f6.title: Unsurprisingly the two Marks are spot on here.

paragraphs.text: Unsurprisingly the two Marks are spot on here. I worrh though that people are constantly inundated with the jargon — Machine Learning/Deep Learning/AI and misunderstand the differences and similarities.
paragraphs.name: 1dfc

paragraphs.text: The real danger though is that people get jaded with the terms and assume this is another “Big Data” — terminology that…

1aa1d3090335.title: Not surprisingly, his supporters feel the same way about his haters.

paragraphs.text: Not surprisingly, his supporters feel the same way about his haters. Nothing will change their minds as long as they get their information from the same narrow basketful of sources and logic and fact are wasted on them.
typo
paragraphs.name: e42e

paragraphs.text: Totally agree. It may happen a tad slower than 3yrs IMO, but AL & ML is the only safe tech job in the future if you ask me. Anyone looking to start learning ML, I’ve got a podcast for beginners: http://ocdevel.com/podcasts/machine-learning
paragraphs.name: ab66

f81f2d1f44ef.title: I can understand the hesitancy of tech companies going public, especially tech startups that have…

paragraphs.text: I can understand the hesitancy of tech companies going public, especially tech startups that have reached the unicorn mark. Appeasing wall street with strong quarterly results and being seen as overvalued are two reasons. Thanks for adding the interviews on your podcast.
paragraphs.name: eb82

paragraphs.text: So Cuban is learning “AI”. AI doesn’t exist. Pseudonym for deep learning that’s still uninterpretable.
paragraphs.name: 6d2e

42176626f597.title: That was a long time ago, when AI wasn’t even a thing.

paragraphs.text: That was a long time ago, when AI wasn’t even a thing. What does it/he have to do with AI now other than throwing money at it?
paragraphs.name: c8d2

6540c0b2cf0c.title: As a VC — do you see a point where majority of your job (or that of your analysts) gets replaced by…

paragraphs.text: As a VC — do you see a point where majority of your job (or that of your analysts) gets replaced by AI. How you determine success rates based on the personal, organizational and market indicators you use when investing? I think with enough data on personal and psychological traits of founders even personal/gut descisions made by VCs will be assisted by AI. Scary thought.
paragraphs.name: d616

6f8a8aad3b66.title: I agree that AI is the future, but before it gets started in earnest, I think we need to work out…

paragraphs.text: I agree that AI is the future, but before it gets started in earnest, I think we need to work out the moral and philosophical issues. If at some time if it ever becomes self aware, we have to decide if turning it off will be murder. I think becoming self aware is not that far away. Sure, the super computers that have the storage and processing power…
paragraphs.name: f58c

816d52f00491.title: And it’s worth noting that sophisticated and powerful AI/ML code is worthless without access to…

paragraphs.text: And it’s worth noting that sophisticated and powerful AI/ML code is worthless without access to massive amounts of data. So the real issue is who owns, controls or can buy access to data.
paragraphs.name: 974a

9445ee97d3e2.title: Cuban and Suster are just like Charlie Munger — they read and read and read.

paragraphs.text: Cuban and Suster are just like Charlie Munger — they read and read and read. Formula for success is to read and read. AI and machine learning was important to me, but now is critical!
paragraphs.name: 323c

paragraphs.text: I have a Ph.D. in CS with a focus on artificial intelligence and about 11 years experience working in AI, NLP, and machine learning. I have an MS in bioinformatics, which I got because the job market for AI was so bad, and 5 years work experience in that. I have a BS in math and about 1 year of work in cryptography. When I send out my resume, I…
paragraphs.name: ade0

virtuals.subtitle: If you don’t get your PhD from MIT, Stanford, or Carnegie Mellon, or possibly U Toronto or U Mich, don’t bother studying AI. No one will…

dc7ddcfc23ca.title: 100% agree that AI is the most compelling area of computing today.

paragraphs.text: 100% agree that AI is the most compelling area of computing today. I have long been focused on data for entertainment but now I see all that data as simply fodder for AI. AI and ML eat data. Getting the right piece of content to the right consumer and personalization is enabled by metadata. But we have rapidly evolving beyond that. AI needs micro…
paragraphs.name: b86a

b70129530355.title: Good points. Let’s hope that’s only beginning and wait for AI to show outstanding economic results.

paragraphs.text: Good points. Let’s hope that’s only beginning and wait for AI to show outstanding economic results.
